description:
Nova has a --limit flag that can be passed thru the python-novaclient. Currently, images/glance.py in Nova needs to pass this value in as 'page_size' so that it can be properly interpreted by python-glanceclient.

Relevant pieces of code:
https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v1/shell.py#L81
https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v1/images.py#L175
https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/v2/images.py#L49
title: Nova should pass in page_size to python-glanceclient

comments.content:
python-glanceclient has a DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE variable hard coded to 20 in /v1 and /v2. If a query does not specify a page size, this default value is used.

Nova has a --list param that can be passed with an image-list call, but it does not appear to be working, as glance client will sent 5 requests with limit 20 instead of 1 with 100 if 100 is specified as the limit.

Upon further look, it appears there is an issue with variable naming. Glance client is expecting the attribute to be called "page_size", hence it is not parsing the "limit" attribute and is instead using the DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE value.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jared-culp
